style: Concise explanations that respect reader intelligence

examples.goodHeadline: Build brand-coherent web experiences with AI that understands design systems
examples.badHeadline: Revolutionary AI Magic That Will Transform Your Web Design Forever!

audience.primary: Design-conscious developers and technical product builders
audience.secondary: Design teams at startups and growth companies
painPoints: Generic AI tools that ignore brand consistency
Too much manual polish needed after AI generation
Difficulty maintaining design systems across projects
Time wasted translating feedback into implementation
Disconnect between design vision and coded reality
desiredOutcomes: Scale design quality without scaling team size
Bridge gap between design intent and implementation

values: Tools that augment rather than replace skill
fears: AI-generated design that looks obviously AI-made
aspirations: Work at a higher level of abstraction
Focus on strategy rather than pixel-pushing

emotionalJourney.arrival: Intrigued - this feels different from typical AI tools
emotionalJourney.engagement: Understanding - this is systematic, not magical
emotionalJourney.conversion: Confident - ready to see what I can build with this

imagery: UI screenshots showing real design systems
Architectural diagrams of how the system works

mustAvoid: Hiding technical details behind marketing speak
Cluttered layouts that undermine message of 'systematic design'
mustRespect: WCAG AA minimum for all pages
Clean, semantic HTML that demonstrates our own values
Fast page loads (design tools should be performant)
Clarity over cleverness in all communication

specificRequirements: All interactive elements must have clear focus states
Color must never be the only indicator of meaning

legal.regulatoryContext: None currently, but maintain data privacy transparency

referenceWebsites.why: Precision and clarity in communicating a technical product
referenceWebsites.whatToTake: Clean hierarchy, confident minimalism, respect for user intelligence
referenceWebsites.whatToAvoid: Don't copy their specific visual style - take the *approach*

referenceWebsites.why: Developer-focused but approachable, technical without being dry
referenceWebsites.whatToTake: Tone of voice, balance of detail and clarity
referenceWebsites.whatToAvoid: Their specific color palette and illustration style
Overly minimal - we need to explain more than they do

examples.notes: References are for TONE and APPROACH, not visual copying. Flow Studio should have its own distinct visual identity.

seo.tagline: AI design agents that understand your brand
seo.metaDescriptionTemplate: Flow Studio: Build brand-coherent web experiences with AI agents that understand design systems, tokens, and your unique brand voice.

localization.culturalNotes: Primary audience is global but English-speaking developer/designer community

customFields.productPhilosophy: Augment human design intelligence rather than replace it. Systematic rather than magical. Transparent rather than opaque. Brand-aware rather than generic.
customFields.technicalTransparency: Show how the system works. Don't hide behind 'AI magic' - explain the agent architecture, token system, brand engine.
